wiki.summary: "So Good" is a song by Halsey, released as a single through Capitol Records on June 9, 2022. It was written by Halsey themself, Sarah Aarons and Sammy Witte. Two days after the song was released, Halsey performed it live for the first time at the 2022 Governors Ball Music Festival. "So Good" is a "wistful pop ballad". Halsey confirmed that the song is lyrically about their relationship with their boyfriend and the father of their son, screenwriter Alev Aydin, who directed and co-stars alongside her in the official music video. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "So Good" is a song by Halsey, released as a single through Capitol Records on June 9, 2022. It was written by Halsey themself, Sarah Aarons and Sammy Witte. Two days after the song was released, Halsey performed it live for the first time at the 2022 Governors Ball Music Festival. "So Good" is a "wistful pop ballad". Halsey confirmed that the song is lyrically about their relationship with their boyfriend and the father of their son, screenwriter Alev Aydin, who directed and co-stars alongside her in the official music video. In the chorus, she sings: "When you left, I bet you held her body closer / And I was hoping you'd tell her it was over / You're all I think about in every way I look / I know it's bad, but we could be so good". Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
